cc

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • cc.Sprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Obstacle, Projectile

    public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    The sprite class represents an entity of a given World.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Robert, Dalton, Brian, Derek
    See Also:
    World

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bounce(Sprite s)
      The bounce method rebounds the velocity of this sprite in the x and/or y direction from an obstacle.
      abstract void collide(Sprite s)
      The collide method defines collision behavior for the sprite upon collision with another sprite.
      void exchange(Sprite s)
      The exchange method sets the velocity of this sprite to the velocity of a colliding sprite.

      void setWidth(int width) 
      protected void setWorld(World world) 
      void slide(Sprite s)
      The slide method sets the position of a colliding object such that its bounding box lies on the edge of the colliding object's bounding box.
      abstract void update()
      The update method updates the state of the sprite.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(int width,
              int height,
              Vector2 position,
              Vector2 velocity,
              Vector2 acceleration,
              java.awt.Color color,
              World world)
        7-Argument Sprite Constructor
        Parameters:
        width - width
        height - height
        position - position vector
        velocity - rate of change in position vector
        acceleration - rate of change in rate of change of position / rate of change in velocity / acceleration vector
        color - color
        world - plane of existence
